adjective.description: Relating to the imposition or enforcement of a rule or method.
examples: these guidelines are not intended to be prescriptive

adjective.description: (of a right, title, or institution) having become legally established or accepted by long usage or the passage of time.

origin: Mid 18th century: from late Latin praescriptivus relating to a legal exception, from praescript- directed in writing, from the verb praescribere (see prescribe).
